message_1: What is the value of the function f(x) = x² + 3x - 4 at x = 5 in Higher-order logic?
message_2:
To find the value of the function f(x) = x² + 3x - 4 at x = 5, we simply substitute the value of x into the equation and solve for f(x).

f(5) = (5)² + 3(5) - 4
f(5) = 25 + 15 - 4
f(5) = 40 - 4
f(5) = 36

So, the value of the function f(x) = x² + 3x - 4 at x = 5 is 36.
